Topic.Title: Fair Marketplace bill, not applied to ebay???

Message.Msg: That's another problem, too. I don't know why they want to do like Amazon. Burdening the headache to sellers was good for Ebay just being the middle man. It seems that they want to do real business.

Message.Title: Ebay with internet exsuberence (amzn, ntflx,lnkd) should be over $100, but its stuck in $50s. Why?
Message.Msg: ecommerce, discovery deal, 1 hour delivery rollout, global growth/outreach

Topic.Title: yahoo has raised ebay year target to $63.92

Message.Msg: (not $54.94 but $53.94 ) Don't call a person a liar if youy can't keep your facts straight !!

Topic.Title: Fair Marketplace bill, not applied to ebay???

Message.Msg: this bill would be amended a few months after introductiion to include all sellers. they wont let pick companies create dozens of little subsiderarys to circumvent the taxes

Topic.Title: yahoo has raised ebay year target to $63.92

Message.Msg: Spoken like a true pumper. If the panties fit, wear them, if they don't, send them to John Donahoe and his oversized bootie you love smooching.

Topic.Title: Fair Marketplace bill, not applied to ebay???

Message.Msg: That would be more trouble than it's worth considering the fact the sales tax is charged to the buyer anyway. Not to mention, any company doing such to avoid taxes would be illegal and subject to federal prosecution. In this bill, they're not after small sellers, they're after large online retail outlets.

Topic.Title: Ebay with internet exsuberence (amzn, ntflx,lnkd) should be over $100, but its stuck in $50s. Why?

Message.Msg: PUMPER. Want to know why eBay isn't worth even $50 a share? Here's why... Yesterday, I called Netflix to put my account on hold for the next three months because I will be out of town on a work contract. Immediately, I got a US, English speaking customer service rep who handled my call and we were done in less than 2 minutes. Called Amazon to put my seller account on hold. Same thing, US based English speaking rep and done in less than 5 minutes. Called eBay 6 times, no joke, each time I got some loser in Asia who couldn't even understand what I was talking about. After nearly 3 hours of calling, I finally got my call escalated and even the manager couldn't assist me. End of story, I closed my eBay account. That's why eBay is an epic fail. Worst customer service in the world. Not only didn't my problem get dealt with, it cost them hours of customer service and they lost my business forever. Wow, that's real success.
Right on. Excellent comment !!!

Ain't that the truth. eBay is the lowest, slimiest, money-grubbing, lying, cheating, stealing company ever. I don't know how our government allows them to operate without investigation. So much for consumer protection in the US.

Message.Title: donohoe will be adding collected sales tax to EBITDA
Message.Msg: Count on it

Topic.Title: donohoe will be adding collected sales tax to EBITDA

Message.Msg: He already adds all the money Paypal holds or freezes, sales on eBay where buyers never pay, overbilling glitches, etc... so that wouldn't be any surprise. The Pumpers and bagholders will get giddy about eBay's "supposed" 6-10% increase. eBay sells themselves as a Frank Lloyd Wright architecture but truth is they're built by third graders out of popsicle sticks, paper clips, tin foil and duct tape.

Topic.Title: donohoe will be adding collected sales tax to EBITDA

Message.Msg: Not to mention, eBay will surely collect FVF's on the sales tax portion of a purchase.

Topic.Title: donohoe will be adding collected sales tax to EBITDA

Message.Msg: They will if they can get away with it.

Message.Title: ebay lowered fees
Message.Msg: free listings, and smaller final value fees. There has to be a catch !

Yeah right. eBay are masters of spin and deception. Premium store owners now pay $10 per month more for the store and listing fees doubled from .05 per listing to .10 per listing. So they give you 500 free listings per month. Sellers with more than 2000 items will be paying double what they are now before they even make the first sale. 9% Final Value fees across the board means sellers of items over $1000 will now be paying up to 300% more in fees. Another pack of lies from the eBay department of spin. Considering eBay claims they're doing so well, it's amazing they've raised fees 3 times in the last 4 years by almost 300% ~ More like a sign of a company in serious trouble.

eBay will never, ever hit $100 per share. Not in a million years and certainly not with John Donahoe as CEO. Try as it might, it never even gets to $60 but keep pumping. rah rah rah drink that kool-aid.

Topic.Title: donohoe will be adding collected sales tax to EBITDA

Message.Msg: Like charging final value fees on the shipping portion of a transaction? hmmm, what does eBay have to do with UPS, packing and shipping? Guaranteed they will add the tax into closing price and collect fees on that.

its better for sellers with smaller stores. I always thought that 3 cent listing fees for the whales hurt exposure for smaller vendors. A company in China could make 100,000 listing for a few thousand dollars with the cheap labor.

Topic.Title: We have no job for you either John Osborne
